intro: Oenothera boquillensis, commonly known as the Boquillen evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, typical of the Onagraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Oenothera boquillensis is valued for its ecological role and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental beauty.
